alert.note: Alert for San Jacinto (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 10 at 2:11AM CDT until May 14 at 2:45PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following county, San Jacinto. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Periods of showers and thunderstorms will impact the region today. Locally heavy rainfall will be likely and could result in localized flooding. Widespread rainfall totals of 2 to 4 inches are expected. Totals of 5 to 7 inches are possible in locations that receive locally heavier rainfall. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
